cover-01.title: Let's Compare Angular, Vue, React, and Vanilla JavaScript
cover-01.author: Bob Fornal
cover-01.bio1:
Entrepreneur
Code-squid provides solid, in-depth frontend training that is supported with real-world code projects. Blessed husband and proud father of two.
cover-01.bio2:
Senior Solutions Developer
Leading EDJE, Inc.
Passionate about learning, testing, mentoring, speaking, and personal growth.
cover-01.notes: Starting with a simple project design we will look at the various design considerations in several categories (initialization, components, services, event handling, build tooling, and testing) to compare and contrast the various strengths and weaknesses of Vanilla JavaScript, Angular, Vue, and React.

what-to-compare.title: What (and How) Are We Comparing?
what-to-compare.text3:
Library

  • Set of reusable functions.

Framework

  • Set of code that dictates project architecture.
  • Provide standard way to build and test applications.

angular-details--1.title: Angular Details (1/2)
angular-details--1.text1:
AreaNotes
Documentation
  • Based on John Papa's AngularJS Documentation.
  • Strong documentation on "why;" OPINIONATED.
  • Versioning back to v2
Community
  • Smaller than Vue, then React.
  • Strong corporate support (Google).
Installation
  • ng CLI (with ng new); solid structure.
Build Tools
  • ng build.
  • Uses Webpack to bundle code, assets, and dependencies into optimized files for deployment.
  • ng [new|generate|serve|build|test|lint].

angular-details--2.title: Angular Details (2/2)
angular-details--2.text1:
AreaNotes
Tooling
  • Library Creation: (to extend Angular functionality)
Release Cycles
  • A regular release schedule, allowing for planning and coordination of updates.
  • Major: every 6 months (May and Nov), Minor: 1-3 for each major release, and Patch Release: almost weekly.
  • Deprecation: Marked deprecated; deprecation phase lasts two major versions (minimum).
Testing
  • Test structure installed with each ng generate command.
  • Karma (test runner), Jasmine (testing framework), and Protractor (end-to-end testing).

vue-details--1.title: Vue Details (1/2)
vue-details--1.text1:
AreaNotes
Documentation
  • Only v2 and v3.
  • Solid documentation for beginner to advanced.
Community
  • Strong community of passionate developers.
Installation
Build Tools
  • Vue CLI

vue-details--2.title: Vue Details (2/2)
vue-details--2.text1:
AreaNotes
Tooling
  • Lightweight library to add interactivity to a website or enhance specific parts of an application.
  • Framework to build a complete web application.
  • Web Component Patterns.
Release Cycles
  • Limited corporate support means that supporting tools and libraries take time to catch up.
Testing
  • (Unit Tests) Recommends: Vitest; optionally: Jest
  • (Component Tests) Recommends: Vitest; optionally: Cypress
  • (E2E) Recommends: Playwright or Cypress; optionally: Nightwatch or WebdriverIO

react-details.title: React Details
react-details.text1:
AreaNotes
Documentation
  • Solid Documentation
Community
  • Strong corporate support (Facebook); translated into bootcamp use and lots of developer experience.
Installation
  • Next.js, Remix, Gatsby, Expo, (Next.js App Router); legacy: Create React App
  • Many options for installation; each is a different opinion.
Build Tools
  • React "lets you focus on code, not build tools."
Tooling
  • Web Component Patterns.
Release Cycles
  • No set timeframe.
  • Strong plan for Stable Releases, Breaking Changes, Latest, Canary, and Experimental.
Testing
  • Recommended Tools: Jest and React Testing Library.

javascript-details.title: JavaScript Details
javascript-details.text1:
AreaNotes
Documentation
  • MDN: thorough documentation.
  • http://vanilla-js.com/
Community
  • Who doesn't use JavaScript?
Installation
  • UNNECESSARY.
Build Tools
  • UNNECESSARY.
Tooling
  • Web Components: Foundational.
Release Cycles
  • Language specification (ECMAScript) and browser implementation and adoption.
  • ECMAScript: annual while browsers are independent and release on a rolling basis.
Testing
  • Can use Jest, Jasmine, or others.
javascript-details.notes: The phrase, "you don't know what you don't know." - story: requirement for a range slider, found one, made changes, first commit to another repository. Had unknowingly modified a Web Component. More opportunities in ways to build things.
